intro: Hieracium tarradasum, commonly known as the Canary Islands hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Hieracium tarradasum is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to the unique climate of the Canary Islands.
